subject: Re: Need info on GUI testing
msgSnippet: ... David Saff recently suggested Abbot on this list, and you ve already heard about jfcUnit. I suggest you look over the examples given in those projects and
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "moin_m19" <moin_m19@...> wrote:
> I am new to Junit. I am working on a project which involves Applets.
> We are following standards of seperating GUI logic and Business logic.
> In such case how JUnit can be implemented?
> For example in case of login page, the GUI and actionListener are in
> different classes. How can Junit be done?

David Saff recently suggested Abbot on this list, and you've already
heard about jfcUnit. I suggest you look over the examples given in
those projects and see how they are used.

> I was trying a program listed on
> http://www.developer.com/java/other/article.php/10936_1016841_1 for
> Junit. Its asking for junit.extentions.jfcunit.* , in the
> junit-4.2.jar file above mentioned packages are not found. Where to
> get these packages from?

jfcUnit is not part of the core JUnit distribution. You need to go to
the jfcUnit website and download the code from there.

HTH,
Joe

HTH,
Joe
